page.title: 07BURLEIGH FARM,MALBOROUGH (1)
page.content: Fred and Doris Baker live on the farm with their son William.Their other son Barry lives in{New Burleigh}just down the road from the farm.Fred and Doris also have two daughters Liz and Linda. Linda has twin girls Sophie and Jane (7) and Liz has a younger child. They have chickens and cows on the farm.They have about 20 chickens and 65 cows.In the milking parlour they can milk 6 cows at a time by the milking machine.The cows produce about 1150 litres a day all together.The farmer owns 153 acres.They only use 6 fields for cattle but use 5 for plants and crops.The two sons work on the farm,and on an average day they get up about 7am, get dressed and have their breakfast.Then they go out to start work on the farm.Then in evening they finish at about 7pm.
